pandae667 wrote:
> Dear IA-Team,
> 
> I'm wondering if there is something like a
> DomainQueueAssignementPolicy (I need this to make sure not to crawl
> more than one host located on the same domain at once - otherwise I
> might DoS customers that use loads of different sub-hostnames for
> different purposes.)
> 
> If nothing alike exists yet I'd implement such a policy based upon
> SurtAuthorityQueueAssignmentPolicy.

Nothing like that yet exists.

If it is only an issue only for a certain known set of domains, you can 
use the "force-queue-assignment" frontier setting in a domain override 
to force all URIs in subdomains into the same queue.

(Specifically: if this setting is non-empty, all URIs to which the 
setting applies will have this string, rather than the string given by 
the assignment-policy, as its queue name.)

A policy to do this would be a valuable contribution. Of course, for 
different top-level-domains the number of domain-segments that reflect 
"same domain" (in a meaningful shared-ownership sense) varies.

- Gordon @ IA
